Interface Board


  • public interface Board
    Board objects represent the state of the Oware board, including the number of seeds in each of the houses and in the two score houses, where captured seeds are placed. Players are numbered 1 and 2 and each player has houses numbered 1..6. Board objects are updatable by accepting moves. Board objects are constructed either from nothing (default constructor), or by cloning. Cloning is needed during game play to ensure that players are not able to update the game board directly. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oware for the layout and rules of Oware. These are summarised in community.dur.ac.uk/s.p.bradley/teaching/IP/assignment_oware//

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        void makeMove(int house,
              int playerNum)
       throws InvalidHouseException,
              InvalidMoveException
        update the board to make a move from the specified house of the specified player
        Parameters:
        house - in range 1..6 representing the house position (starting from anticlockwise)
        playerNum - in range 1..2
        Throws:
        InvalidHouseException - if the range or playerNum are not in the right range
        InvalidMoveException - if the house does not represent a valid move because either the house is empty, or the move would leave the opponent without a move to make

      • getSeeds

      throws InvalidHouseException
        the number of seeds in the specified house of the specified player. See makeMove() for parameterDetails
        Throws:
        InvalidHouseException
